summary: This document is an email chain from November 2020 regarding the processing and transfer of hard drives containing productions (likely evidence) in the US v. Epstein case. It discusses the stamping and exporting of data by a vendor, coordination between legal or technical staff, and mentions a planned extension request to Judge Nathan.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: Mentioned as the judge to whom an extension request is being planned regarding the production timeline in the US v. Epstein case.

events.title: Discussed Production Deadline
events.description: A date that had been discussed as a deadline for the production, but an extension to Judge Nathan was being planned.

keyFacts: The document is an email chain concerning the technical processing (stamping and exporting) of evidence productions for the US v. Epstein case.
A vendor was handling the data, breaking the production into seven parts, and loading it onto hard drives.
The correspondence indicates coordination for the physical transfer of hard drives containing productions 15 and 16.
An extension request to Judge Nathan regarding the production timeline was being planned, suggesting ongoing legal proceedings.
The emails reference a database named 'Relativity', which is a common e-discovery platform used in legal cases.
